The complexity of oncology makes it a prime ﬁeld for data-driven research projects with the potential to greatly improve patient care. BD-STEP is a two-year fellowship opportunity that uses data science to advance cancer research and patient care. Competitively selected postdoctoral fellows work with VA Medical Center clinicians and interdisciplinary researchers to address important patient-centered health challenges.


BD-STEP offers an avenue to access rich, diverse VA data resources, including diagnosis and treatment information from the VA Central Cancer Registry and longitudinal, clinical data from the VA’s national healthcare system. The combination of data access, academic mentorship, and clinical guidance allows fellows to formulate and address clinically important questions in cancer research.


Interested postdoctoral fellows should talk to their academic supervisors about the program, discussing the time commitment and their desire to participate. They should also consider the VA Medical Center locations to which accepted BD-STEP fellows will be appointed. For more program details, please visit https://cssi.cancer.gov/bd-step and https://www.va.gov/oaa/specialfellows/programs/sf_bdstep.asp


  1. Please have your academic mentor (existing or planned research relationship) complete a letter of support for participation in the program. Note, applications will not be accepted without mentor’s approval.
  2. Complete application and submit the following materials:
    • Curriculum Vitae (CV)
    • A brief statement of interest (no more than one page) to include proposed research areas/topics
    • Letter of support from academic mentor
